content: In linear_algebra.finite_dimensional finite_dimensional is defined as a reducible def (and not a structure or class) but later on in the file it is used in square brackets. What's going on there? Does this work?
I guess since it's just an abbreviation for is_noetherian it is actually a class.

Is this causing you some trouble? Or are you just curious? (Me too.)
We had a similar sort of thing in the category theory library for a while where we tried to def "having limits of shape K" as a function: having a limit of every diagram of shape K. It seemed to work fine for a while but then in more complicated cases the elaborator got confused. Eventually we turned it back into a class (structure) with one field.
